text: Draft at the brewery taproom during RBWG 2016. Pours deep brown with a creamy, beige head. The nose holds ashy roast, baking cocoa. Medium sweet flavour with notes of sugary chocolate, more baking cocoa, mild earthy bitterness. Full bodied with fine to average carbonation. Sweet on the finish with further sugary chocolate, good roast, charred wood. Solid, this one.
Draft at RBWG: Poured a dark roasted brown with a tan head. Aroma was super roasted malt. Taste was mix of roasted malts, chocolate and licorice.

Draft at the brewery. Pours a nearly opaque coffee brown with small lasting beige head that settles into an island of film and a ring around the edge, leaving heavy lace in the glass. Notes of roasted malts, earth, cocoa, coffee, and tobacco. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a roasty, earthy, slightly bitter and sweet mouthfeel. Nice stout. Given the ABV, roastiness, and the fact that its not particularly dry, Im not sure its quite to style. But its good.

Dry stout at nearly 8%?
More export style to me. Malt forward, very deep flavors. Not as smooth as the porter, but just as good.
[1/30/16] Draught at Cooperage Brewing in Santa Rosa. Black. Aroma of roast, coffee, licorice, piney hops. Bitter roasty flavor with coffee, licorice, ash, piney hops. Medium-bodied.

Keg at the brewery tap, 30/01/16.
Dark black with a well appointed tan covering that retains well - a looker.
Nose is dark malt, light spice, chocolate, tar.
Taste comprises toffee fudge, chocolate, light charr, tar, bitter rub.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with roasty bite.
Solid for the style.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Sample on tap at the brewpub. Black pour with white head. Aroma is very roasty, burnt grain, light hoppiness. Taste is super roasty, light coffee, light grassy finish. Palate is med bodied, creamy, light carbonation. Tasty.

Draught at Cooperage. Opaque black liquid with small to medium tan head. Aroma of licorice, light smoke, raw sugar, bread and coffee. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of licorice, coffee and bread. Medium to full bodied with medium carbonation. Nice.
On tap at Cooperage. Pours dark brown with a thick tan head and a treacle aroma. There is a medium-bodied dark molasses flavor with a dry finish.

Draft at the brewery. Opaque black coloured pour with a lasting mid tan head. Aroma is roast coffee, nutty malts, ash, burnt toast. Flavour is composed of dry ashy roast, black malts, roasted barley, burnt toast, ashy. Palate is dry, medium light, little thin, highish carbonation. Drying finish. Lingering bitter roast.

Tap @ Cooperage. Reddish brown appearance with a brown head. Quite roasty, lightly smoky, chocolate, burnt sugar aroma. Off dry. Moderate bitterness. Marshmallows, chocolate, and light smoke in the flavor. Good.

Draft to mini-snifter at Cooperage. Looks solid; a translucent dark amberish brown with beige head. Smells of dark malt, chocolate, and a bit of toast. Tastes like it smells, but toastier. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied and on the drier side. A decent example of the style.
Draft - Dark roasty notes and some coffee notes. Jet black with a rich light brown head. Dark roast and a dry chocolate finish.
On tap at the brewery. Pours a very dark brown with small tan head that lasts. The aroma is roasted malt and chocolate. Medium mouth, dry, cocoa, vanilla, light booze finish, very good.
Draft at source. Strong coffee nose. Black pour. Taste is very bitter chocolate forward. Lightly acidic. Hella good.
Black with some tan foam, coffee and chocolate aromas, dryish, a bit tannic and lightly creamy in texture with some heft, pretty tasty. A very solid, easy drinker.
